intro: Desfontaena, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plants typically have basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Desfontaena species are often found in open grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. They are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
